channel.title: Apple on Martin Proks
channel.description: Recent content in Apple on Martin Proks

item.title: Week 26 (23-29/06/2025)
item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • AI talk by Andrej Karpathy which took internet by storm link.
  • Although not the most secure solution for DNS (i.e. TLS), but still nicely visualized link.
  • Youtube’s fake buffering and its breakdown link.
  • Another massive #password leak link.
    • As always 2FA + password manager can help reducing the risk
  • Another great write-up by Cloudflare about blocking large DDoS attack link.
  • If you MacBook gives you buzzing sensation, you are not alone link!
    • Apple time to fix this issue …

ðŸ”¬Science

  • Scientists identity all kinds of information by collecting just environment DNA in Dublin.link.
    • Could this be done on a large scale to track uprising diseases?
  • Promising tooth implants tested in rats link.
  • Liu’s lab created specialized electrodes from fluorinated elastomers which can be attached and “expand” with developing brain in order to measure neuron activity link.

ðŸ”— Links

  • Finland introduces sand battery to store heat as a cost-efficient and sustainable alternative link.
  • Timeline of Virtual Cells concept link.
  • DuckLake: Mix of metadata and files link.

ðŸ”§ Tools

  • EbodShojaei/bake: Make formatter and linter
  • axboe/fio: Benchmarking tool for I/O

item.title: Week 24 (09-15/06/2025)
item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • Commentary from Garry Marcus on the latest criticism of LLMs “reasoning” from Apple (link).
    • Interesting notes:
      • LLM might fail from inference outside of training distribution (out-of-distribution), same problem as perceptron
      • The main take home is that LLMs are not thinking, at least based on puzzle examples in the paper
  • OS for public sector by EU, currently POC (link).

ðŸ”¬Science

  • Focused ultrasound stimulation could be the alternative treatment in future (link).
    • Idea started with chronic inflammation; possible other candidates are diabetes (already tested on mice, pigs and was published)
    • Could be converted into wearable device in future, allowing easy access for anyone

ðŸ”— Links

  • Marco writes about his own experience with Severely Deficient Autobiographical Memory / Aphantasia (link)
    • TL;DR: Difficulty to recall information through visualization
    • Youtube: Missing Mind’s Eye: Solving the Mystery of Aphantasia
  • DIY budget server for AI/ML (link)
  • Emerging Startup AheadComputing focuses on building the next new CPU (link)
  • Apple really likes to make those API calls (link).

ðŸ”§ Tools

  • resemble-ai/chatterbox: Resemble AI’s first production-grade open source TTS model.
  • AasishPokhrel/shit: This is kinda funny ðŸ˜….
